STIL de Grain, in the colour trade, the name of a compoſition uſed for painting in oil or water, and is made of a decoction oſ the lycium or Avignon berry, in alum-water, which is mixed with whiting into a paſte, and formed into twiſted ſticks. It ought to be
choſen of a fine gold yellow, very fine, tender, and friable, and free from dirt.
